title: Week Review: Place Structures
goal: Master place structure concepts and all Week 4 vocabulary.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Quick translation — say the Lojban:

1. I see you.                    → ?
2. Bob gives an apple to Alice.  → ?
3. I take this from you.         → ?
4. Do you know that?             → ?

(Answers: mi viska do, la .bob. cu dunda la plise la .alis., mi lebna ti do, xu do djuno ta)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

What You Learned This Week

1. Place Structure Concept

Every gismu has a fixed blueprint:

  • x1, x2, x3... are numbered slots
  • Each slot has a specific meaning
  • Sumti fill slots in order, left to right

2. Variety of Place Counts

Places Example Structure
2 viska x1 sees x2
3 dunda x1 gives x2 to x3
4 vecnu x1 sells x2 to x3 for x4
5 klama x1 goes to x2 from x3 via x4 by x5

3. The zo'e Placeholder

Use zo'e to skip middle places:

  • mi klama zo'e la .london. — I go (somewhere) from London.
  • mi dunda zo'e la .bob. — I give (something) to Bob.

4. Week 4 Gismu (10)

Gismu Structure English
dunda x1 gives x2 to x3 give
vecnu x1 sells x2 to x3 for x4 sell
lebna x1 takes x2 from x3 take
bajra x1 runs run
viska x1 sees x2 see
tirna x1 hears x2 hear
penmi x1 meets x2 meet
djuno x1 knows x2 about x3 know
cusku x1 says x2 to x3 say
benji x1 sends x2 to x3 send

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (10 points)

Translate to English:

  1. viska →
  2. dunda →
  3. lebna →
  4. vecnu →
  5. benji →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. hear →
  2. meet →
  3. know →
  4. say →
  5. run →
Answers
  1. see
  2. give
  3. take
  4. sell
  5. send
  6. tirna
  7. penmi
  8. djuno
  9. cusku
  10. bajra

Part B: Place Structure (6 points)

Write the place structure:

  1. dunda — x1 ___ x2 to x3
  2. lebna — x1 ___ x2 from x3
  3. vecnu — x1 ___ x2 to x3 for x4

Identify x1, x2, x3 in these sentences:

  1. mi benji la plise la .bob.
    • x1 = ?
    • x2 = ?
    • x3 = ?
Answers
  1. gives
  2. takes
  3. sells
  4. x1 = mi, x2 = la plise, x3 = la .bob.

Part C: Translation (6 points)

Translate to English:

  1. mi viska la gerku
  2. la .alis. cu dunda la plise la .bob.
  3. do lebna ti mi

Translate to Lojban:

  1. I hear a cat.
  2. Bob sends this to Alice.
  3. You sell a dog to me.
Answers
  1. I see a dog.
  2. Alice gives an apple to Bob.
  3. You take this from me.
  4. mi tirna la mlatu
  5. la .bob. cu benji ti la .alis.
  6. do vecnu la gerku mi

Part D: Using zo'e (3 points)

Translate to Lojban using zo'e:

  1. I go from Paris. (destination unspecified)
  2. Alice gives (something) to Bob.
  3. I sell (something) to you for ten.
Answers
  1. mi klama zo'e la .paris.
  2. la .alis. cu dunda zo'e la .bob.
  3. mi vecnu zo'e do pa no

Scoring

Section Points Your Score
Part A 10 ___
Part B 6 ___
Part C 6 ___
Part D 3 ___
Total 25 ___

Interpretation:

  • 23-25: Excellent. Ready for Week 5.
  • 18-22: Good. Review weak areas, then proceed.
  • 13-17: Fair. Revisit Days 3-6 before moving on.
  • Below 13: Repeat Week 4.

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Scenario: A Transaction

Create a mini-story using at least 5 different gismu from this week:

Example:

mi penmi la .bob.
.i la .bob. cu vecnu la plise mi
.i mi lebna la plise la .bob.
.i mi dunda re no la .bob.
.i mi cusku ki'e la .bob.
.i mi viska la plise .i ti melbi

(I meet Bob. Bob sells an apple to me. I take the apple from Bob. I give twenty to Bob. I say thanks to Bob. I see the apple. This is beautiful.)

Write your own mini-story and say it aloud.

Week 4 Complete Reference

Gismu (10):

Lojban Place Structure English
dunda x1 gives x2 to x3 give
vecnu x1 sells x2 to x3 for x4 sell
lebna x1 takes x2 from x3 take
bajra x1 runs run
viska x1 sees x2 see
tirna x1 hears x2 hear
penmi x1 meets x2 meet
djuno x1 knows x2 about x3 know
cusku x1 says x2 to x3 say
benji x1 sends x2 to x3 send

Key Cmavo:

Lojban Function
zo'e unspecified (placeholder)

Cumulative vocabulary: 38 gismu (12 + 8 + 8 + 10)

Summary

You completed Week 4. You now deeply understand place structures — the fixed blueprints that define each gismu. You can fill multiple places in order, use zo'e to skip middle places, and work with gismu ranging from 2 to 5 places.

Next week preview: Week 5 introduces se and te — words that let you reorder places, putting different sumti in x1 position without changing the meaning.

Congratulations

mi djuno ti .i do djuno ti .i mi'a djuno ti

(I know this. You know this. We know this.)

Four weeks complete. You're handling real Lojban structure now.
